content:
I work on browser agents and foundational models for the web in the Amazon AGI SF Lab. I was briefly at Adept AI Labs before our team moved over to Amazon. Prior to that, I graduated with a Ph.D. from MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL) advised by Mohammad Alizadeh. My thesis focused on using computer vision techniques to improve video conferencing experience under low-bandwidth and lossy network conditions. I also worked on applying ideas from communication networks to payment channel networks to improve blockchain scalability, and network monitoring and heavy-hitter detection.
Previously, I received a B.S.E. in Computer Science from Princeton University where I worked with Jennifer Rexford.
I am also trained in Bharatanatyam, a classical dance form from South India.
summary: I work on browser agents and foundational models for the web in the Amazon AGI SF Lab. I was briefly at Adept AI Labs before our team moved over to Amazon. Prior to that, I graduated with a Ph.D. from MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL) advised by Mohammad Alizadeh. My thesis focused on using computer vision techniques to improve video conferencing experience under low-bandwidth and lossy network conditions.
title: Vibhaa Sivaraman

summary: Use generative models for the face to reduce bandwidth consumption during video calls.
title: Gemino: Practical and Robust Neural Compression for Video Conferencing

summary: Use attention to leverage multiple reference frames to improve high-frequency conditional super-resolution/
title: Multi-Resolution Multi-Reference Talking Head Synthesis via Implicit Warping

summary: New rate control mechanism for faster bandwidth increase and decrease on variable networks.
title: Vidaptive: Efficient and Responsive Rate Control for Real-Time Video on Variable Networks

summary: Use token-based transformers for the face to improve loss resilience during video calls.
title: Reparo: Loss-Resilient Generative Codec for Video Conferencing

summary: Topology design to improve throughput for credit networks
title: The Effect of Network Topology on Credit Network Throughput

summary: Separation of bitstream into content and model stream to improve compression.
title: Efficient Video Compression via Content-Adaptive Super-Resolution

summary: Packet-switched architecture and balance-aware routing mechanism to improve transaction throughput in payment channel networks
title: High Throughput Cryptocurrency Routing in Payment Channel Networks

summary: A rate control mechanism to ensure video-QOE fairness for multiple clients sharing a bottleneck.
title: End-to-End Transport for Video QOE Fairness

summary: Packet-switched architecture and balance-aware routing mechanism to improve transaction throughput in payment channel networks
title: Routing Cryptocurrency with the Spider Network

summary: An algorithm for detecting flows with large traffic volumes at line-rate.
title: Heavy-Hitter Detection Entirely in the Data Plane
